alert.note: Alert for Dauphin (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 6:06AM EST until December 21 at 7:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek Above Middletown affecting Dauphin County. For the Swatara Creek...including Middletown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swatara Creek above Middletown. * WHEN...From this morning to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor over bank flooding begins near the Vine Street Bridge downstream to the Susquehanna River. At 12.0 feet, Both banks overflow upstream of the Vine Street Bridge and several basements are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of around 12 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.
